comment: If you have the chance to take Dr. Grant DO IT!! She is the most caring and amazing teacher I have ever met! She makes sure students do well and tells them exactly how to get an A she's so great and super sweet too!

So sweet! This is a research-based class, so be prepared to master MLA formatting. 4 essays, 2-3 discussion board posts every week, and no quizzes or homework. She outlined everything clearly and always told you what she wanted out of each paper. I HIGHLY encourage you to take her class as I have taken her for both 1101 and 1102.

This class was definitely one of my favorites. If you go to class, she explains the terms and helps her students understand it. If you have questions, she will answer them, and she will go into more detail about them if you ask her after class. She's a good professor to take for English 1101! Highly recommend!

Honestly one of the best professors at Kennesaw. She is the best when it comes to explaining assignments and is always willing to help. I strongly encourage you to take her for 1101. If she could be my professor for all my classes I would be the happiest person in the world. Highly recommend!!

I had Professor Grant for both ENGL 1101 and 1102 and she was amazing. Grades are broken into 5 categories each worth 20%. The 5 categories are attendance/participation and 4 papers. Professor Grant gave extra credit on papers for going to the Writing Center. She is also always available to help students and responds quickly to emails.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is really nice and you can tell that she really cares about what she is teaching. There are a coupe of discussion posts you have to do every week but they aren't difficult at all.

She is AMAZING! Attendance is mandatory as you will have to complete a discussion board post every day. She is extremely passionate and dedicated to inspiring growth in your writing. I definitely recommend taking her class!

Prof. Grant is goated. Simple as that. She is really nice and grades super easy. Class consists of weekly discussion posts and a total of 4 papers. If you actually go to class and try, it is an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Wonderful professor, and very organized course. Everything supports each other, and assignments lead into the next assignments. She has personality and is very understanding and nice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly the best professor I've ever had. On our last day in class virtually, everyone was telling her how amazing she was. We had to write several essays that all built up to writing an 1800 word argumentative research paper. She's not a very tough grader so If you do everything on the rubrics you should get A's on your papers. Take her class!

Genuinely the nicest professor I've ever had. I had her for both 1101 and 1102 and she really cares about helping you and making you better as a writer. Love her and would take her for every English class if it was possible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: The best professor at Kennesaw State! This was overall my favorite class and professor. If you get the chance to have her class, take it! She is very caring and understanding and she always responds to your emails in 5 minutes or less. She is always willing to work with you and help you with any problems, and she makes writing fun and easy. easy A!
Shes amazing and is always willing to work with you for a better grade. Extremely flexible!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This was my best professor this semester. She is so sweet and really works to make sure everyone understands the material. She is a very reasonable grader when it comes to essays and is always willing to help you improve. Lots of participation grades to help. You get to choose the topic of your essays to choose what matters to you.
